title: Cell-Specific Gene Expression Design: Synthetic Biology-Based Mathematical Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary biology, high school-level mathematics (functions, statistics, matrix operations), and basic concepts of gene expression
context.additional_context: Project-based learning for learners aspiring to medical/technical careers, focusing on solving biological problems through mathematical modeling

learning_goals: Learners can explain the mathematical principles of deep learning models used in synthetic biology and build a simple gene expression prediction model
Learners can apply matrix operations and probability distributions for analyzing transcription factor binding site (TFBS) motif frequency
Learners can convert experimental data (chromatin accessibility, gene expression levels) into matrix form to analyze correlations between features
Learners can design linear/nonlinear regression models to predict cell-specific expression from 50bp synthetic regulatory sequences
Through team projects, learners can establish and present second-generation design improvement strategies

resources: Python-Based Mathematics/Science Computation Libraries (Jupyter Notebook, NumPy, Pandas)
Human Cell Line Gene Expression Dataset (Open Data)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
